abstract.text: This namespace contains essential keyboard-related types.
This view renders keyboard a button title text.
This enum defines how much the backspace key deletes.
This view can be used to render a collapsed keyboard,
e.g. when an external keyboard is connected.
This view can be used to create keyboard buttons for
various keyboard actions.
This type specifies global keyboard state.
This type is used for essential keyboard settings.
KeyboardKit helps you create fully customizable keyboard extensions, using Swift and SwiftUI.
This style defines the shadow of a keyboard button.
This type can be used to customize the related style
with
This type can be used to define metadata for locales
that have been added to a keyboard.
This button style can be used for plain buttons that are
used in keyboard extensions.
This type describes how to apply a diacritic.
This view can be used to toggle between two toolbars.
This view renders the content for a certain keyboard
button, based on a provided action and style service.
This protocol is an alias for other protocols that model
types in the framework should conform to.
This view renders a space bar context menu title.
This view mimics a native keyboard button key shape.
This enum defines supported space drag sensitivities.
This view can be used to mimic a native iOS keyboard.
This style defines the border of a keyboard button.
This type can be used to customize the related style
with
This enum defines various keyboard return key types.
This is the input controller to use in KeyboardKit-based
keyboard extensions.
This enum defines spacebar context menus that can be
added as leading and trailing items to the spacebar.
This view can be used to preview a
with various actions, themes and services.
This view makes any view behave as a native keyboard
switcher button, which switches to the next keyboard
when tapped, and opens a switcher menu on long press.
This article describes the essential parts of KeyboardKit.
This style can be used to modify the visual style of
the
component.
This class defines the standard keyboard behavior of
a standard western keyboard, with some locale tweaks.
This enum defines various input toolbar modes, which
can be used to set how an input toolbar is displayed.
This enum defines various keyboard gestures that can
be used to interact with a keyboard.
This enum can be used to define when a screen should
show a certain section or part of the user interface.
This protocol can be implemented by view components that
can render parts of a
This type specifies global keyboard services.
This enum defines animations that can be used with a
This enum defines supported keyboard layout types.
This class has observable states and persistent settings
for the core keyboard functionality.
This is a standard toggle toolbar toggle, which uses
a custom
as toggle view.
This view mimics a native keyboard button shadow.
This background style can define the background of a
keyboard, or any component within it.
This type can be used to replace character(s) with a
diacritic variant.
This view mimics a native number pad keyboard.
This enum defines keyboard auto-capitalization types.
This protocol can be implemented by any classes that can
be used to control a keyboard extension.
This view renders standard system space key content.
This protocol can be implemented by any classes that can
define keyboard-specific behaviors.
This enum defines various keyboard types for various
kinds of inputs.
This view renders button item for a
This enum defines supported keyboard dock edges.
This namespace contains essential keyboard-related types.
This enum defines various keyboard shift states.
This style can be used to style a
This enum defines various space long press behaviors.
This view can be used to render a toolbar with a min
height, to ensure that callouts are not cut off.
This view creates a keyboard bottom row with leading
and trailing actions around a space key.

builder that
